content:
Mathematically 12546 is done, and accurately captures the ubiquitous notion of Freiman homomorphisms. These are very important in additive combinatorics, so would be good to get this merged, once people are happy with the Lean of it all.

(To clarify: this PR moves definitions from Algebra.Group.Freiman to Combinatorics.Additive.FreimanHom and does some other Lean refactoring. I am not at all testifying about whether these changes are right or appropriate, which is more of a Lean issue - I'm just vouching that the definitions as they stand now are correct mathematically, and also that given the importance of Freiman homomorphisms it would be good to get people to look at this and merge it when done.)

I added a few comments that basically suggest to define
IsFreimanHomOn n A without reference to the target set B, and adding MapsTo f A Bwhen needed.
Oh, Johan merged #12701 while I was reviewing it
@Ruben Van de Velde Whoops, sorry
I was a bit too fast there, my apologies
